tit.e: Makimuku burial mounds (burial mounds in Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture)
Makimuku-kofun Tumulus Cluster (a tumulus cluster in Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture)
Makimuku-kofun Tumulus Cluster (a tumulus cluster in Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: 纏向古墳群（まきむくこふんぐん）は、奈良県桜井市に所在する。
sen.e: Makimuku burial mounds are located in Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Makimuku-kofun Tumulus Cluster is located in Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.
Makimuku-kofun Tumulus Cluster is located in Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 古墳時代前期初頭の古墳群である。
sen.e: These burial mounds were made at the beginning of the first half of the Kofun period (tumulus period).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The tumulus cluster was made at the beginning of the first half of the Kofun period (tumulus period).
The tumulus cluster was made at the beginning of the first half of the Kofun period (tumulus period).

sen.j: 本古墳群は、柳本古墳群の南に位置し、三輪山の西麓に広がっている。
sen.e: These burial mounds are located in the south of Yanagimoto burial mounds and spread over the west foot of Mt. Miwa.
This tumulus cluster is located in the south of Yanagimoto-kofun Tumulus Cluster and spread over the west foot of Mt. Miwa.
This tumulus cluster is located in the south of Yanagimoto-kofun Tumulus Cluster and spread over the west foot of Mt. Miwa.

sen.j: なかでも箸墓古墳（箸中山古墳）は、定型化した最初の前方後円墳である。
sen.e: Above all, Hashihaka Tumulus (Hashinakayama Tumulus) is the first stereotyped large keyhole-shaped tomb mound.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処; 当初、「（箸中山」と「古墳）」の間で文が切れており、「古墳)」以下は後列に入っていたため、「前方後円墳であり」までの部分をこの列にコピー&ペーストし、そこで文を分割しました。青の塗りつぶしがない箇所であり、上記のように不完全な文だったので「一原文一訳文の例外対処」に該当するかどうかは分かりませんが、いずれにせよ不完全部分を修正し、文を分割しましたので、「例外対処」と記載しました。/箸墓古墳: 2つの訳語が登録されていますが、他の古墳の表記に合う訳語を採用しました。
sen.e: Above all, Hashihaka-kofun Tumulus (also known as Hashinakayama-kofun Tumulus) is the first stereotyped large keyhole-shaped mound.
Above all, Hashihaka-kofun Tumulus (also known as Hashinakayama-kofun Tumulus) is the first stereotyped large keyhole-shaped mound.

sen.j: 3世紀の中頃に築造されたと推定される。
sen.e: It is estimated to have been constructed approximately in the middle of the third century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is estimated to have been constructed approximately in the middle of the third century.
It is estimated to have been constructed approximately in the middle of the third century.

sen.j: その頃から古墳時代が始まったとされている。
sen.e: The Kofun period is said to have begun at that time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Kofun period is said to have begun at that time.
The Kofun period is said to have begun at that time.

sen.j: さらに、『魏志』倭人伝のいう邪馬台国の女王卑弥呼の墓ではないかと想定されている。
sen.e: Furthermore, it is supposed to be the tomb of Himiko (first known ruler of Japan), the queen of Yamatai-Koku kingdom described in Gishiwajinden (an 'Account of the Wa [inhabitants of the western Japanese archipelago in the late third century]' in "The History of the Wei Dynasty" which comprises "The History of the Three Kingdoms" written by Chen Shou, where the account is known as the first historical record of Japan).

Furthermore, it is supposed to be the tomb of Himiko (first known ruler of Japan), the queen of Yamatai-Koku kingdom described in "Gishi" Wajinden (an 'Account of the Wa [inhabitants of the western Japanese archipelago in the late third century]' in "The History of the Wei Dynasty" which comprises "The History of the Three Kingdoms" written by Chen Shou, where the account is known as the first historical record of Japan).

Furthermore, it is supposed to be the tomb of Himiko (first known ruler of Japan), the queen of Yamatai-Koku kingdom described in "Gishi" Wajinden (an 'Account of the Wa [inhabitants of the western Japanese archipelago in the late third century]' in "The History of the Wei Dynasty" which comprises "The History of the Three Kingdoms" written by Chen Shou, where the account is known as the first historical record of Japan).

sen.j: 宮内庁は、倭迹迹日百襲姫命大市墓として管理している。
sen.e: The Imperial Household Agency administers it as the tomb of Yamatototohimomosohime no mikoto at Oichi.
sen.cmt: 倭迹迹日百襲姫命大市墓: 定訳不明。サイト「http://www.bell.jp/pancho/k_diary-2/2009_07_02.htm(注: アクセスすると音楽が再生されます)」等によれば「大市」は地名なので、その意味で訳しています。
sen.e: The Imperial Household Agency manages it as the Mausoleum of Yamatototohimomosohime no mikoto (Princess Yamatototohimomosohime) at Oichi.
The Imperial Household Agency manages it as the Mausoleum of Yamatototohimomosohime no mikoto (Princess Yamatototohimomosohime) at Oichi.

sen.j: 纏向遺跡内の古墳は，纏向型前方後円墳と呼ばれている。
sen.e: The tumuli at the Makimuku site are referred to as Makimuku style of a large keyhole-shaped tomb mound.
The tumuli at the Makimuku ruin are referred to as Makimuku style of a large keyhole-shaped mound.
The tumuli at the Makimuku ruin are referred to as Makimuku style of a large keyhole-shaped mound.

sen.j: 郡中には帆立貝式古墳が多い。
sen.e: There are many scallop-shaped mounds there.
There are many scallop-shaped mounds in the cluster.
There are many scallop-shaped mounds in the cluster.

sen.j: 次のような特徴を持っている。
sen.e: They have the following characteristics:
They have the following characteristics:
They have the following characteristics:

sen.j: 後円部に比べ前方部が著しく小さく低平である。
sen.e: Compared with the rounded part, the front part is remarkably small, low and flat.
Compared with the back circular part, the front square part is remarkably small, low and flat.
Compared with the back circular part, the front square part is remarkably small, low and flat.

sen.j: 墳丘全長・後円部直径・前方部の長さの比は、正しく3:2:1を原則としている。
sen.e: The ratio of the whole length of the tumuli, the diameter of the rounded part to the length of the front part is exactly three, two to one in principle.
sen.cmt: 原文で「321」となっていた箇所をWebで確認すると「3:2:1」でしたので、原文を訂正しました。
sen.e: The ratio of the whole length of the tumuli, the diameter of the back circular part to the length of the front square part is exactly three, two to one in principle.
The ratio of the whole length of the tumuli, the diameter of the back circular part to the length of the front square part is exactly three, two to one in principle.

sen.j: 後円部は、扁球・倒卵か不正円形で正円形でない。
sen.e: The form of the rounded part is not an accurate circle, but an oblate spheroid, an obovoid shape, or an inaccurate circle.
sen.cmt: 扁球: http://tangorin.com/words/扁球/倒卵: 英辞郎 on the Web/不正円形、正円形: 定訳不明
sen.e: The form of the back circular part is not an accurate circle, but an oblate spheroid, an obovoid shape, or an inaccurate circle.
The form of the back circular part is not an accurate circle, but an oblate spheroid, an obovoid shape, or an inaccurate circle.

sen.j: 周濠を持つ古墳は、前方部が狭い。
sen.e: The front part of a tumulus surrounded with a moat is narrow.
sen.cmt: 周濠: 用語集の訳語を、文の構造に合わせて変更しています。
sen.e: The front square part of a tumulus surrounded with a moat is narrow.
The front square part of a tumulus surrounded with a moat is narrow.

sen.j: 纏向勝山古墳
sen.e: Makimuku Katsuyama Tumulus
sen.cmt: 「…古墳」として登録されている訳語は「…Tumulus」とされているものが多く、今回の翻訳でもこちらを採用しているため、用語集の訳語をこの表記に合わせて変更しました。また、用語統一リストに従い、用語集の訳語からハイフンを削除しました。
sen.e: Makimuku Katsuyama-kofun Tumulus
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Makimuku Katsuyama-kofun Tumulus

sen.j: 纏向矢塚古墳
sen.e: Makimuku Yazuka Tumulus
sen.cmt: 用語集の訳語の「古墳」は「Tumulus」に変更しました。また、用語統一リストに従い、用語集の訳語からハイフンを削除しました。
sen.e: Makimuku Yazuka-kofun Tumulus
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Makimuku Yazuka-kofun Tumulus

sen.j: 纏向石塚古墳
sen.e: Makimuku Ishizuka Tumulus
sen.cmt: 用語集の訳語の「古墳」は「Tumulus」に変更しました。また、用語統一リストに従い、用語集の訳語からハイフンを削除しました。
sen.e: Makimuku Ishizuka-kofun Tumulus
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Makimuku Ishizuka-kofun Tumulus

sen.j: 東田大塚古墳
sen.e: Higaida Otsuka Tumulus
Higaida Otsuka-kofun Tumulus
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Higaida Otsuka-kofun Tumulus

sen.j: 箸墓古墳または箸墓中山古墳
sen.e: Hashihaka Tumulus or Hashihaka Nakayama Tumulus
Hashihaka-kofun Tumulus or Hashihaka Nakayama-kofun Tumulus
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Hashihaka-kofun Tumulus or Hashihaka Nakayama-kofun Tumulus

sen.j: ホケノ山古墳
sen.e: Hokenoyama (Mt. Hokeno) Tumulus
sen.cmt: 用語集の訳語の「ホケノ山」の後に、指示書に従った「Mt. Hokeno」を補い、「古墳」の訳語は「Tumulus」に変更しました。
sen.e: Hokenoyama-kofun Tumulus
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Hokenoyama-kofun Tumulus
